item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You don’t forget the face of the person who was your last hope." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You love me. Real or not real?" I tell him, "Real." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Some walks you have to take alone." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "It must be very fragile, if a handful of berries can bring it down." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare?” I say.
“I don't know. I don't think I cry out or thrash around or anything. I just come to, paralyzed with terror,” he says.
“You should wake me,” I say, thinking about how I can interrupt his sleep two or three times on a bad night. About how long it can take to calm me down.
“It's not necessary. My nightmares are usually about losing you,” he says. “I'm okay once I realize you're here." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Aim higher in case you fall short." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I just want to spend every possible minute of the rest of my life with you." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"So I only say, "So what should we do with our last few days?"
"I just want to spend every possible minute of the rest of my life with you," Peeta replies." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Katniss, the girl who was on fire!" -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"I'm coming back into focus when Caesar asks him if he has a girlfriend back home. Peeta hesitates, then gives an unconvincing shake of his head.
Handsome lad like you. There must be some special girl. Come on, what’s her name?" says Caesar.
Peeta sighs. "Well, there is this one girl. I’ve had a crush on her ever since I can remember. But I’m pretty sure she didn’t know I was alive until the reaping."
Sounds of sympathy from the crowd. Unrequited love they can relate to.
She have another fellow?" asks Caesar.
I don’t know, but a lot of boys like her," says Peeta.
So, here’s what you do. You win, you go home. She can’t turn you down then, eh?" says Caesar encouragingly.
I don’t think it’s going to work out. Winning...won’t help in my case," says Peeta.
Why ever not?" says Caesar, mystified.
Peeta blushes beet red and stammers out. "Because...because...she came here with me." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "My nightmares are usually about losing you. I'm okay once I realize you're here." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I wish I could freeze this moment, right here, right now and live in it forever." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Deep in the meadow, hidden far away A cloak of leaves, a moonbeam ray Forget your woes and let your troubles lay And when it's morning again, they'll wash away Here it's safe, here it's warm Here the daisies guard you from every harm Here your dreams are sweet and tomorrow brings them true Here is the place where I love you." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I don't want to lose the boy with the bread." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Destroying things is much easier than making them." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Halley add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Halley add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Halley add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every artist was first an amateur." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Halley add a quote by Michael Faraday
item.description: "Nothing is too wonderful to be true if it be consistent with the laws of nature." -- Michael Faraday

item.title: Halley add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "The greatest polution problem we face today is negativity. " -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Halley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Halley add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34" -- Anonymous

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "The time has come for us to stand a little taller, to lift our eyes and stretch our minds to a greater comprehension and understanding of the grand millennial mission of this, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Halley add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Entreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: For wither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God." -- Anonymous

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "If Life Gets Too Hard To Stand, Kneel." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Try a little harder to be a little better." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You have not failed until you quit trying." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Halley add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "I am the last leaf on the tree, and the wind is blowing." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
